meanings.definition: A type of marine invertebrate that moves by contracting and pumping water through its gelatinous body.
meanings.sent1: The salp gracefully propels itself through the ocean by contracting its body.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the salp to understand how it moves in the water.
meanings.sent3: The salp decided to have a race with the jellyfish to see who could swim faster.
meanings.sent4: The salp, like a tiny submarine, navigates the sea with its unique propulsion system.
meanings.sent5: Children at the aquarium were fascinated by the transparent salp swimming in the tank.

meanings.definition: A gelatinous, barrel-shaped marine animal that floats in large groups in open water.
meanings.sent1: The salp drifted peacefully in the ocean alongside its companions.
meanings.sent2: A school of salps bobbed up and down in the waves.
meanings.sent3: The salp threw a party for all its barrel-shaped friends in the sea.
meanings.sent4: The salp colony resembled a floating village on the surface of the water.
meanings.sent5: Tourists on the boat were amazed by the sight of countless salps floating in the sea.

meanings.definition: A transparent, barrel-shaped organism that is a major component of plankton.
meanings.sent1: The tiny salp played a crucial role in the ecosystem as part of the plankton.
meanings.sent2: Plankton researchers collected samples of salps to study their impact on marine life.
